title: Consumers with a newspaper or magazine subscriptions in the U.S. 2017 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Retirees and lowest at Response Millennials.
There is a difference of 21.0 between the maximum Response Retirees and minimum Response Millennials.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 5 number of Responses.
The maximum Share of respondents 54.0 is found at Response Retirees and the minimum is found at Millennials where Response is 33.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is appeared to be the highest at Response Retirees and lowest at Response Millennials.
There is a difference of 21.0 between the maximum Response Retirees and minimum Response Millennials.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Share of respondents for 5 number of Responses.
The maximum Share of respondents 54.0 is found at Response Retirees and the minimum is found at Millennials where Response is 33.0.
The Share of respondents of Response Millennials is 1.64% smaller than the maximum value at Retirees.
Response Retirees is higher than any other Responses with value 54.0, followed by Boomers, and Total. Down to Response Millennials with the lowest value 33.0.
The Response Millennials tends to be 1.3 percent lower than average.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 208.0.
